name: Mortal Kombat: Tournament Edition
description:
This semi-sequel to Mortal Kombat: Deadly Alliance brings together a handful of the previous characters with a host of new and well-known faces making their debut on the GBA, including Bo Rai Cho, Johnny Cage, Raiden, Sareena, Nitara, Cyrax, Mavado, Reptile, Hsu Hao and Drahmin.

Game modes include a collection of new multiplayer modes, such as the Race to Raiden, where two players compete against a set of characters, and the first to reach and defeat Raiden wins. Up to 4 players can compete in Tournament mode to see who is the best fighter.

Plus there's plenty of single player modes including Survival, while you can link Tournament Edition with Deadly Alliance to play some of the multiplayer modes.

shot.caption: Title screen.
Main menu.
Character selection.
"Kombatants" overview.
First battle in progress: Johnny Cage tries to attack Rayden using his fast-speed move Shadow Kick.
Trying to crush Drahmin's guard, Bo' Rai Cho attacks using his spitting-based move Puke Puddle.
Quickly recovered of Cyrax's "Slice-and-Dice" move damage, Johnny Cage is able to resume the match!
Meanwhile, in a subsequent battle, Cyrax must find a way to avoid Sareena's skull-shaped projectile.
Using some swinging-sword moves, Scorpion starts an massive counterattack in a defensive Nitara.
Rayden torturing Reptile through the expansive strength of his electric sparkle-based move Shocker.
Taking advantage of a superb opportunity, Nitara could connect her Unicorn Kick move in Sareena.
With some quick steps, Scorpion escapes at time to avoid be struck by Quan Chi's Winged Strike move.
Shang Tsung's Diving Punch move meets Hsu Hao's Kahn Klap move: this time, Tsung's blow is faster!
Bo' Rai Cho uses a ground-stomping move and causes a simple change in Shang Tsung's energy bar...
Through the "Bios" option, you can know a lot of the facts that surrounds each "kombatant".
Scorpion attacks Drahmin with his spear-based move: the end result is favorable to the ninja...
Nitara tries a counterattack against Hsu Hao and is about to finish one of her Weapon Moves.
About to start the "Test Your Sight" minigame, Scorpion takes enough concentration...
Vulnerable for a fast moment, Johnny Cage was easily struck by Sareena's Flip Kick move!
Johnny Cage executing the last hit of his Slide Uppercut move in Shang Tsung.
Rayden defeats Reptile successfully in the Round 2 and executes his winning pose.
Noob Saibot tries to strike back Hsu Hao, but the ninja is struck by one of his Weapon Moves.
Bo' Rai Cho uses his Belly Bash move against Cyrax, connecting successfully its frontal hit.
Sektor's winning pose after having executed with success his Weapon Fatality.
Through a shoulder-slam-style move, Rayden starts the counterattack against Scorpion.
Mavado is about to damage Sareena with his Flying Hook move: it's a question of time...
Practice session showing Scorpion using his move Summon Hellfire against Mavado.
For being a little far away from Mavado, Cyrax's kick are seriously risked to fail...
Nitara attacks Quan Chi using a Roundhouse Kick and connects its accurate hit in him.
Reptile uses one of his Weapon Attacks against Shang Tsung, but he could block it...
